Q1: Who is Ross McMillan?
A1: Ross McMillan is a professional rugby union player.

Q2: What is Ross McMillan's position in the team?
A2: Ross McMillan plays as a hooker.

Q3: Where was Ross McMillan born?
A3: Ross McMillan was born in Chesterfield, England.

Q4: Which clubs has Ross McMillan played for professionally?
A4: Ross McMillan has played for Nottingham, Gloucester, Moseley, Coventry, Birmingham & Solihull, Northampton, Bristol and Leicester Tigers.

Q5: When did Ross McMillan represent England at U19 level?
A5: Ross McMillan represented England at U19 level whilst with his first professional club Nottingham.

Q6: How long was Ross McMillan signed to Gloucester for?
A6: Ross McMillan was signed by Gloucester on a 2 years contract ahead of competition from other Premiership clubs.

Q7: What happened to Ross McMillan during the 2008-09 season?
A7: In a friendly prior to the 2008-09 season, Ross McMillan suffered a ruptured cruciate ligament against Aviron Bayonnais, a season-ending injury.

Q8: Where did Ross McMillan join Northampton Saints from?
A8: Ross McMillan joined Northampton Saints midway through the 2011-2012 season from Birmingham & Solihull as a triallist.

Q9: How long was Ross McMillan's contract with Northampton Saints?
A9: Ross McMillan was awarded a short-term contract in February 2012, followed by a full contract after his appearance as a substitute in the LV= Cup final.

Q10: What did Bristol sign Ross McMillan for in January 2015?
A10: Bristol signed Ross McMillan on an 18-month contract.

Q11: Where is Ross McMillan currently playing?
A11: Ross McMillan is currently playing for Leicester Tigers.

Q12: How long is Ross McMillan's contract with Leicester Tigers?
A12: Ross McMillan signed a 3-year contract with Leicester Tigers in August 2018.

Q13: What is Ross McMillan's current role at London Irish?
A13: Ross McMillan is the Assistant Forwards Coach at London Irish.

Q14: When did Ross McMillan leave Leicester Tigers?
A14: Ross McMillan left Leicester Tigers in May 2019 after the end of the 2018-19 Premiership Rugby season.

Q1: What was John McMahon's role in Surrey County Cricket Club?
A1: John McMahon was an orthodox left-arm spin bowler who played for Surrey County Cricket Club from 1947 to 1957.

Q2: Why did Somerset County Cricket Club sign John McMahon in 1954?
A2: Somerset County Cricket Club signed John McMahon in 1954 to fill a vacancy for a left-arm orthodox spinner, as Horace Hazell had retired and Roy Smith had failed to live up to expectations.

Q3: What was John McMahon's best bowling performance in the 1955 season?
A3: John McMahon's best bowling performance in the 1955 season was against Kent at Yeovil, where he took eight wickets for 46 runs in the first innings.

Q4: Why was John McMahon dropped from the Somerset team in 1957?
A4: John McMahon was dropped from the Somerset team in 1957 due to an embarrassing episode at a hotel during a festival in Weston-super-Mare, along with Jim Hilton.

Q5: What did John McMahon do after he left Somerset County Cricket Club?
A5: After leaving Somerset County Cricket Club, John McMahon played in the Lancashire League for Milnrow Cricket Club and later contributed articles to cricket magazines.
